From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia


2023 film by Jacob Byrd
AdalynnOfficial release posterDirected byJacob ByrdWritten byJerrod D. BritoProduced by
Jacob Byrd

Sydney Carvill

CinematographyRich VarvilleEdited byRich VarvilleMusic byVahid JahandariProductioncompanyJacala ProductionsDistributed bySummer Hill FilmsRelease date

Running time88 minutesCountryUnited StatesLanguageEnglish
Adalynn is a 2023 drama horror film directed by Jacob Byrd in his feature debut and written by Jerrod D. Brito. The film stars Sydney Carvill, Wade Baker, Janet Carter, Rob Shuster and Suzana Norberg.


Plot[edit]
A stalker obsesses over a mother and her newborn while she is dealing with postpartum depression.

Cast[edit]
Sydney Carvill
Wade Baker
Janet Carter
Rob Shuster
Suzana Norberg
Production[edit]
The film is the feature debut of Jacob Byrd.[1] Principal photography was in San Diego.[2]

Release[edit]
The film was distributed by Summer Hill Films and released on VOD on March 28, 2023.[3]

Reception[edit]
Critical response[edit]
The film has an 80% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes based on five reviews.[3] Abbie Bernstein at Assignment X rated it a B−, claiming it "isn’t wholly satisfying, but it is effectively disquieting."[4] Rich Cross at Starburst Magazine rated it a 3 out of 5.[5] Alan Ng at Film Threat scored it a 6.5/10.[6] In a less favorable review, Keri O'Shea at Warped Perspective rated it a D, claiming the intentions are excellent but that it lacks too much budget.[7]
